data.text:
Pulkit Samrat Age

Pulkit Samrat age is 40 years. He was born on 29 December 1983 in New Delhi, India.

Biography

Pulkit Samrat Height, Physical Measurements

Family

Educational Qualifications

Pulkit Samrat Movies

Early Life

Samrat was born on December 29, 1983, in Delhi and was raised in a Punjabi Hindu family involved in real estate. He attended Manav Sthali School and completed his schooling at Montfort Senior Secondary School in Ashok Vihar, Delhi.

He initially enrolled in an advertising course at Apeejay Institute of Design in Delhi. However, after five months, he received a modeling assignment, prompting him to leave his studies and move to Mumbai, where he joined an acting course under the guidance of Kishore Namit Kapoor.

Career

In 2005, Samrat relocated to Mumbai to pursue his acting career. By 2006, he made his acting debut in the popular television series “Kyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi” produced by Balaji Telefilms. His performance alongside notable actors such as Mouni Roy, Smriti Irani, and Ronit Roy, among others, marked his entry into the television industry.

In 2008, Samrat participated as a contestant on the reality show “Kaho Na Yaar Hai,” sharing the stage with prominent TV personalities including Mouni Roy, Sanaya Irani, and Karan Patel. This appearance further established his presence in the television world.

Samrat took a significant step in his career in 2011 when he played the lead role in choreographer Vaibhavi Merchant’s musical theatrical production, “Taj Express.” This role showcased his versatility and talent beyond television, earning him recognition in the theater community.

In 2012, Samrat transitioned to films, debuting in the romantic comedy “Bitto Boss” where he starred alongside Fatima Sana Shaikh and Suniel Shetty. This film set the stage for his future in Bollywood. His breakthrough came in 2013 with the film “Fukrey,” where he played the role of Hunny. This ensemble comedy featured a talented cast including Richa Chadha, Ali Fazal, and Pankaj Tripathi, and became a significant hit.

The year 2014 saw Samrat in two major releases. He appeared in “Jai Ho,” a film featuring Salman Khan, Daisy Shah, and Genelia D’Souza, among others. He also starred in “O Teri” alongside Sarah-Jane Dias, Mandira Bedi, and Anupam Kher. These roles solidified his standing in the industry.

In 2017, Samrat reprised his role as Hunny in “Fukrey Returns,” a sequel to “Fukrey.” The film’s success marked a high point in his career, affirming his popularity with audiences. The following year, he played Veer Arora in “Veerey Ki Wedding,” sharing the screen with Kriti Kharbanda and Jimmy Shergill. Additionally, he appeared in “3 Storeys” alongside Sharman Joshi and Richa Chadha.

In 2019, Samrat was part of the ensemble cast of the comedy film “Pagalpanti,” which included actors such as Urvashi Rautela, Ileana D’Cruz, and John Abraham. His performance in this film added to his repertoire of comedic roles.

In 2020, he starred in the thriller drama “Taish,” further diversifying his filmography and demonstrating his ability to tackle different genres. Through these varied roles and performances, Samrat has established himself as a versatile actor in both television and film.
